stanza.line: Thus is his cheek the map of days outworn
When beauty lived and died as flowers donow
Before these bastard signs of fair were born
Or durst inhabit on a livingbrow
Before the golden tresses of thedead
The right of sepulchres were shorn away
To live a second life on secondhead
Ere beauty dead fleece made another gay
In him those holy antique hours areseen
Without all ornament it self andtrue
Robbing no old to dress his beautynew
And him as for a map doth Naturestore
To show false Art what beauty was ofyore
